avalancheActivity.comment:
Since Friday the wind has been moderate at times in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.
As a consequence of wind from westerly directions, sometimes deep wind slabs formed in the last two days.
They can be released easily by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep slopes, caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Reports filed by observers and artificially triggered avalanches have confirmed this situation.
Remotely triggered avalanches are possible in isolated cases, especially along the border with France.
Backcountry touring calls for meticulous route selection. Maintaining distances between individuals and one-at-a-time descents are recommended.
Natural avalanches: Dry slab avalanches and dry loose snow avalanches are possible in isolated cases as before, especially adjacent to ridgelines.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Even single backcountry tourers can release avalanches as before.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Some snow will fall from the afternoon.
30 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Thursday. The moderate wind has transported the new snow.
The wind slabs remain in some cases prone to triggering in particular on very steep shady slopes.
Since Friday in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain many small and medium-sized avalanches were released.
On the night between Thursday and Friday: Numerous medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry slab avalanches have been released on wind-loaded slopes.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall on Monday. The danger will persist.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a sometimes moderate wind from westerly directions, wind slabs formed in the last two days.
They can be released. These avalanche prone locations are to be found on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude.
Natural avalanches: More avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small, especially on extremely steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Some snow will fall in the evening.
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Thursday above approximately 2000 m.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
The old snowpack is favourably layered.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall on Monday. The danger will increase a little during the day.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a mostly light wind from westerly directions, small wind slabs formed.
These can in isolated cases be released by people.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found at intermediate and high altitudes and on very steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Some snow will fall in the evening.
10 to 20 cm of snow fell on Thursday above approximately 1900 m.
The old snowpack will be in most cases well bonded.
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall on Monday. The danger will increase during the day.
